Constructor Detail

CramerShoupAbs

public CramerShoupAbs()
Default constructor. It uses a default Dlog group and CryptographicHash.

CramerShoupAbs

public CramerShoupAbs(DlogGroup dlogGroup,
                      CryptographicHash hash)
               throws SecurityLevelException
Constructor that lets the user choose the underlying dlog and hash. Uses default implementation of SecureRandom as source of randomness.

Parameters:
dlogGroup - underlying DlogGroup to use.
hash - underlying hash to use.
Throws:
SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group or the Hash function do not meet the required Security Level

CramerShoupAbs

public CramerShoupAbs(DlogGroup dlogGroup,
                      CryptographicHash hash,
                      java.security.SecureRandom random)
               throws SecurityLevelException
Constructor that lets the user choose the underlying dlog, hash and source of randomness.

The underlying Dlog group has to have DDH security level.

The underlying Hash function has to have CollisionResistant security level.

Parameters:
dlogGroup - underlying DlogGroup to use.
hash - underlying hash to use.
random - source of randomness.
Throws:
SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group or the Hash function do not meet the required Security Level

CramerShoupAbs

public CramerShoupAbs(java.lang.String dlogGroupName,
                      java.lang.String hashName)
               throws FactoriesException,
                      SecurityLevelException
Constructor that lets the user choose the underlying dlog and hash. Uses default implementation of SecureRandom as source of randomness.

Parameters:
dlogGroupName - name of the underlying dlog group
hashName - name of the underlying hash function
Throws:
FactoriesException - if one of the algorithm's names is not supported
SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group or the Hash function do not meet the required Security Level

CramerShoupAbs

Method Detail

setKey

public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
                   java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
This function sets the Public\Private key.

Specified by:
setKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
Parameters:
publicKey - the public key has to be of type CramerShoupPublicKey.
privateKey - the private key has to be of type CramerShoupPrivateKey.
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the keys are not instances of CramerShoup keys.

setKey

public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
This function sets only the Public key. Setting only the public key the user can encrypt messages but can not decrypt messages.

Specified by:
setKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
Parameters:
publicKey - the public key has to be of type CramerShoupPublicKey.
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key is not instance of CramerShoup key.

generateKey

public java.security.KeyPair generateKey()
Generates pair of CramerShoupPublicKey and CramerShoupPrivateKey.

Specified by:
generateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
Returns:
KeyPair holding the CramerShoup public and private keys

generateKey

public java.security.KeyPair generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                  throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
This function is not supported for this encryption scheme, since there is no need for parameters to generate a CramerShoup key pair.

Specified by:
generateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
Parameters:
keyParams - hold the required parameters to generate the encryption scheme's keys
Returns:
KeyPair holding the public and private keys relevant to the encryption scheme
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if the given parameters don't match this encryption scheme.

generatePrivateKey

@Deprecated
public CramerShoupPrivateKey generatePrivateKey(KeySendableData data)
Deprecated. As of SCAPI-V1-0-2-2 use reconstructPrivateKey(KeySendableData data)

This function does NOT create a new private key. It reconstructs a private key that has been previously serialized.

Parameters:
data -
Returns:

reconstructPrivateKey

public CramerShoupPrivateKey reconstructPrivateKey(KeySendableData data)
Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
Reconstructs a suitable PrivateKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PrivateKey object.

Specified by:
reconstructPrivateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
Parameters:
data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
Returns:
a new PrivateKey with the data obtained as argument

generatePublicKey

@Deprecated
public CramerShoupPublicKey generatePublicKey(KeySendableData data)
Deprecated. As of SCAPI-V1-0-2-2 use reconstructPublicKey(KeySendableData data)

This function does NOT create a new public key. It reconstructs a public key that has been previously serialized.

Parameters:
data -
Returns:

reconstructPublicKey

public CramerShoupPublicKey reconstructPublicKey(KeySendableData data)
Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
Reconstructs a suitable PublicKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PublicKey object.

Specified by:
reconstructPublicKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
Parameters:
data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
Returns:
a new PublicKey with the data obtained as argument

isKeySet

public boolean isKeySet()
Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
Checks if this AsymmetricEnc object has been previously initialized with corresponding keys.

Specified by:
isKeySet in interface AsymmetricEnc
Returns:
true if either the Public Key has been set or the key pair (Public Key, Private Key) has been set;

false otherwise.

getPublicKey

public java.security.PublicKey getPublicKey()
Returns the PublicKey of this CramerShoup encryption scheme. This function should not be used to check if the key has been set. To check if the key has been set use isKeySet function.

Specified by:
getPublicKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
Returns:
the CramerShoupPublicKey
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.

getAlgorithmName

public java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
Specified by:
getAlgorithmName in interface AsymmetricEnc
Returns:
the name of this AsymmetricEnc - CramerShoup and the underlying DlogGroup it uses.

encrypt

public AsymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext)
Encrypts the given plaintext using this Cramer Shoup encryption scheme.

Specified by:
encrypt in interface AsymmetricEnc
Parameters:
plaintext - message to encrypt. MUST be an instance of GroupElementPlaintext.
Returns:
Ciphertext the encrypted plaintext.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Plaintext is not instance of GroupElementPlaintext.
